title: Food safety scandal: Fuel tanker trucks used to transport cooking oil in China, suggests report
Donald Trump challenges 'crooked' Biden for golf battle with $1 million charity bet
content: Former President Donald Trump challenged President Biden to a golf match at his Doral course, offering to donate $1 million to a charity if he loses. Trump's offer, made during a rally, includes a 20-stroke advantage for Biden. Biden's spokesperson criticized Trump’s recent actions and emphasized Biden's focus on leadership, dismissing the challenge as a distraction.
summary: Former President Donald Trump challenged President Biden to a golf match at his Doral course, offering to donate $1 million to a charity if he loses. Trump's offer, made during a rally, includes a 20-stroke advantage for Biden. Biden's spokesperson criticized Trump’s recent actions and emphasized Biden's focus on leadership, dismissing the challenge as a distraction.

title: Chinese father makes daughter collect tears in bowl for watching too much TV
content: A father in Yulin, southern China, punished his 3-year-old daughter, Jiajia, for watching too much TV by making her try to fill a bowl with her tears, captured in a viral video. The incident sparked mixed reactions online, highlighting the spectrum of strict to indulgent parenting in China.
summary: A father in Yulin, southern China, punished his 3-year-old daughter, Jiajia, for watching too much TV by making her try to fill a bowl with her tears, captured in a viral video. The incident sparked mixed reactions online, highlighting the spectrum of strict to indulgent parenting in China.

title: 'It's a historic day ...': Europe celebrates successful Ariane 6 launch after four-year delay
content: Europe's Ariane 6 rocket successfully completed its maiden flight, launching satellites from Kourou, French Guiana, and restoring Europe's autonomous space access. Despite minor issues and a trajectory deviation, the launch marked a significant achievement after a four-year development delay. This success comes amid rising competition in the space industry and Europe's recent lack of independent satellite launch capabilities.
summary: Europe's Ariane 6 rocket successfully completed its maiden flight, launching satellites from Kourou, French Guiana, and restoring Europe's autonomous space access. Despite minor issues and a trajectory deviation, the launch marked a significant achievement after a four-year development delay. This success comes amid rising competition in the space industry and Europe's recent lack of independent satellite launch capabilities.

title: Israeli strike on Gaza school kills 29; likely to damper truce talks
'Nightmare world': Jupiter-sized planet, which is 64 light-years from Earth, reeks of rotten eggs
content: HD 189733 b, a hot Jupiter 64 light-years away, has an atmosphere with hydrogen sulfide, giving it a rotten egg smell. The planet, orbiting its star in 2.2 days, has extreme conditions: 1,700°F temperatures, glass rain, and 5,400 mph winds. This discovery aids understanding of sulfur's role in gas giant formation.
summary: HD 189733 b, a hot Jupiter 64 light-years away, has an atmosphere with hydrogen sulfide, giving it a rotten egg smell. The planet, orbiting its star in 2.2 days, has extreme conditions: 1,700°F temperatures, glass rain, and 5,400 mph winds. This discovery aids understanding of sulfur's role in gas giant formation.

title: In the Aging Senate, Nobody wants to be the one to nudge Biden aside
content: Senate Democrats are grappling with the issue of President Biden's candidacy as concerns grow about his ability to perform. While some members urge him to consider stepping aside, Biden remains firm in his commitment to stay in the race. The situation mirrors past challenges with aging colleagues in Congress.
summary: Senate Democrats are grappling with the issue of President Biden's candidacy as concerns grow about his ability to perform. While some members urge him to consider stepping aside, Biden remains firm in his commitment to stay in the race. The situation mirrors past challenges with aging colleagues in Congress.

title: 54-year-old woman, who received pig kidney transplant plus a heart pump, dies
content: Lisa Pisano, 54, from New Jersey, passed away after living 47 days with a genetically modified pig kidney transplant. She was critically ill with kidney and heart failure. The transplant failed due to inadequate blood flow from a mechanical heart pump. Despite the setback, her case advanced xenotransplantation, offering hope to those in need of alternative organ supplies.
summary: Lisa Pisano, 54, from New Jersey, passed away after living 47 days with a genetically modified pig kidney transplant. She was critically ill with kidney and heart failure. The transplant failed due to inadequate blood flow from a mechanical heart pump. Despite the setback, her case advanced xenotransplantation, offering hope to those in need of alternative organ supplies.

title: ‘Trump will win by a landslide’: Michael Bennet becomes first Democrat Senator to break ties with Biden

Melania Trump's rare appearance at Manhattan fundraiser in a $4,000 dress
content: ​Former first lady Melania Trump hosted a political fundraiser in New York Monday night, Daily Mail reported with details that the red Valentino dress that she wore cost $4,000. Melania hosted an intimate group at Trump Tower to raise money for the Log Cabin Republicans, the largest conservation LGBTQ+ organization.
summary: ​Former first lady Melania Trump hosted a political fundraiser in New York Monday night, Daily Mail reported with details that the red Valentino dress that she wore cost $4,000. Melania hosted an intimate group at Trump Tower to raise money for the Log Cabin Republicans, the largest conservation LGBTQ+ organization.

title: 'How the hell...': Pastor smacks wife on flight. This is the reason
content: A pastor smacked her wife on an Alaska Airlines flight flying from Seattle to Anchorage after she got upgraded to first class but he didn't. The incident took place on July 2 on flight 275 as passengers witnessed the horrific exchange between the couple. The Independent reported that a criminal complained was filed against the pastor.
summary: A pastor smacked her wife on an Alaska Airlines flight flying from Seattle to Anchorage after she got upgraded to first class but he didn't. The incident took place on July 2 on flight 275 as passengers witnessed the horrific exchange between the couple. The Independent reported that a criminal complained was filed against the pastor.

title: Why Nato summit is important for Joe Biden in presidential race
Boeing horror: Mechanic sucked into engine in Iran's Chabahar
content: ​A mechanic was sucked into the engines of a Boeing plane at Iran's Chabahar Konarak airport in a horrific incident that took place earlier this month. According to reports, Abolfazl Amiri was dragged into the engine of the Varesh Airline's Boeing 737-500 when he went near the aircraft to get a tool. The engine was on for a test run.
summary: ​A mechanic was sucked into the engines of a Boeing plane at Iran's Chabahar Konarak airport in a horrific incident that took place earlier this month. According to reports, Abolfazl Amiri was dragged into the engine of the Varesh Airline's Boeing 737-500 when he went near the aircraft to get a tool. The engine was on for a test run.

title: 'The Almighty calls for Biden: They want you gone, sir'
content: The Democratic-media establishment, often considered a powerful force in American politics, is urging President Joe Biden to withdraw from the presidential race, following his disappointing debate performance and subsequent media scrutiny, according to an editorial in the Wall Street Journal. The WSJ reports that the media, which had previously supported Biden, has turned against him, citing instances of cognitive decline.
summary: The Democratic-media establishment, often considered a powerful force in American politics, is urging President Joe Biden to withdraw from the presidential race, following his disappointing debate performance and subsequent media scrutiny, according to an editorial in the Wall Street Journal. The WSJ reports that the media, which had previously supported Biden, has turned against him, citing instances of cognitive decline.

title: Why Nato is losing patience with Canada, Justin Trudeau
content: Canada has been avoiding its NATO defense spending commitments for over a decade, leading to growing frustration among allies. Despite being a strong partner in other areas, Ottawa has not met its domestic military spending goals or invested adequately in new equipment, making Canada an outlier within the alliance. According to a Politico report, a bipartisan group of 23 US senators expressed their disappointment in a letter to Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, urging Canada to fulfill its obligations.
summary: Canada has been avoiding its NATO defense spending commitments for over a decade, leading to growing frustration among allies. Despite being a strong partner in other areas, Ottawa has not met its domestic military spending goals or invested adequately in new equipment, making Canada an outlier within the alliance. According to a Politico report, a bipartisan group of 23 US senators expressed their disappointment in a letter to Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, urging Canada to fulfill its obligations.

title: 'Biden skipped meeting with world leaders so he could go to bed'
content: President Joe Biden in June 2022 skipped a meeting with German officials just a few months after Russia invaded Ukraine so that he could go to bed early, the Wall Street Journal reported. The meeting was kept in the early evening but Biden took a rain check and the German officials were also aware of Biden's fatigue.
summary: President Joe Biden in June 2022 skipped a meeting with German officials just a few months after Russia invaded Ukraine so that he could go to bed early, the Wall Street Journal reported. The meeting was kept in the early evening but Biden took a rain check and the German officials were also aware of Biden's fatigue.

title: 'Collapsed in shower': This Australian family claims their fridge is making them sick
content: ​An Australian family has claimed their fridge is making them so sick that they have never experienced such symptoms in their life. According to an Australian news outlet 9news, Adele and Alex Rae -- the couple -- experienced irritation to the nose, eyes and throat because of a strange smell that they said was coming from their Samsung fridge on May 19.
summary: ​An Australian family has claimed their fridge is making them so sick that they have never experienced such symptoms in their life. According to an Australian news outlet 9news, Adele and Alex Rae -- the couple -- experienced irritation to the nose, eyes and throat because of a strange smell that they said was coming from their Samsung fridge on May 19.

title: 'If I'm elected...': Donald Trump's massive 'will send them to jail' warning
content: ​​Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump said Wednesday if he is elected president, he will send all 'Election fraudsters' to jail for long period of time. "We already know who you are. DON'T DO IT! ZUCKERBUCKS, be careful!" Trump posted on Truth Social. Calling Joe Biden 'incapacitated moron', Trump said Republicans must pass the Save Act or go home.

title: Russia denies involvement in missile strikes at children's hospital in Kyiv
content: Russia has dismissed allegations of its involvement in the missile strikes that damaged a children's hospital in Kyiv on Monday, attributing the damage to Ukraine's anti-missile defense systems instead. Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov clarified Russia's position on Tuesday, stating that the destruction was due to Ukraine's defensive actions. "Russia's stance has never been to target civilian infrastructure in Ukraine," Peskov asserted, though he provided no evidence to support this claim. Peskov urged reporters to rely only on statements by official Russian authority.
summary: Russia has dismissed allegations of its involvement in the missile strikes that damaged a children's hospital in Kyiv on Monday, attributing the damage to Ukraine's anti-missile defense systems instead. Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov clarified Russia's position on Tuesday, stating that the destruction was due to Ukraine's defensive actions. "Russia's stance has never been to target civilian infrastructure in Ukraine," Peskov asserted, though he provided no evidence to support this claim. Peskov urged reporters to rely only on statements by official Russian authority.
